TopicTitle: Anyone know what these things are?

Articles.Content:
Since 1.0 I`ve noticed these white blobs that appear then mostly shoot away from my craft. They don`t seem to have a purpose and only recently I found a static one so here are some screenshots.

anyone have any clues as to what they are?

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/amy5Q)
They might be KSP's Monoliths...

\*puts on tinfoil hat\*

what mods are you using?

[https://youtu.be/Y15NnGZIBuM](https://youtu.be/Y15NnGZIBuM)

It's just like this.

> 
> \*puts on tinfoil hat\*
> what mods are you using?

It happens in stock although I am using many many mods normally.

I first noticed it when I was trying a fully stock game when 1.0 came out as I wanted to see what it was like now.

There was an old bug that occasionally put the POV of the camera under the surface of the world you were on, and there'd be a light source like that at the center of the planet. I think it's a misplaced bit of sunlight reflecting off the surface of the planet. Anyway, it's just a lighting hiccup.

> 
> There was an old bug that occasionally put the POV of the camera under the surface of the world you were on, and there'd be a light source like that at the center of the planet. I think it's a misplaced bit of sunlight reflecting off the surface of the planet. Anyway, it's just a lighting hiccup.

In short, light reflecting off of swamp gas. Move along, please.

> 
> In short, light reflecting off of swamp gas. Move along, please.

It's Venus reflecting off of a weather balloon, giving the illusion of swamp gas. 

![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> It's Venus reflecting off of a weather balloon, giving the illusion of swamp gas. 
> ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

It's reflecting off of the sound stage, making it look like Venus.

\*tinfoilhattery mode activated! \*

The Blobs from Jool's atmosphere have finally gained the technology to leave their planet's gravity well and are speedily heading for Kerbin to seek revenge and wreak havoc. We shouldn't have crashed all these probes into the king of Kerbin's system. 

That, or ball lighting. That's spoooooooky stuff... Spooooooooky!
Update or remove **Distant Object Enhancement**. I've had them too and by removing DOE I got rid of them.

> 
> Update or remove **Distant Object Enhancement**. I've had them too and by removing DOE I got rid of them.

He's a realistic-er! Get 'em!
Wouldn't "Blombs from Jupiter" send out catalogue-purchased killer probes instead? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I get those all the time. They become annoying. Most of the time they are just a white flash that seems to move along the path of the ships orbit. But really I think they are stationary, and the ship is moving past them.

But once I had a ship that landed on the Mun and one of these white spots was right there on the Mun surface. It lit up the whole area, cast shadows, etc.

I don't remember ever seeing them before I started using Distant Object Enhancement and Engine Lighting, so it could be related to one of those mods.

You mean that all those NASA astronauts had to do was remove the mods from their spaceships? No more tricked out sweet rides? ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

[http://www.syti.net/UFOSightings.html](http://www.syti.net/UFOSightings.html) 

(joke's on me. Google's never going to let me forget I searched that link)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-16T21:04:29Z" title="07/16/2015 09:04  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 16, 2015</time> by kreutzkevic**
Looks like space spores to me. That or star jelly. Make sure you sterilize the whole ship after re-entry and quarantine the astronauts for at least a month.

> 
> Looks like space spores to me. That or star jelly. Make sure you sterilize the whole ship after re-entry and quarantine the astronauts for at least a month.

I keep my astronauts permanently quarantined. That's why they are so eager to get away from KSC by jumping on board completely untested rockets.
These have been in the game for ages... I suspect they are part of the game so you get the illusion of movement.

Just one word.

[**FOO**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foo_fighter)

> 
> Just one word.
> 
> 
> [**FOO**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foo_fighter)

It's all Dave Grohl's fault.
I notice them on takeoffs.

> 
> It's Venus reflecting off of a weather balloon, giving the illusion of swamp gas.
> ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Here is a recap:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6ykLonzxpAU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> FOO
> It's all Dave Grohl's fault.

Much older than that--it's [Smokey Stover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smokey_Stover)'s fault.

> That, or ball lighting. That's spoooooooky stuff... Spooooooooky!

If you can beleive it, I saw ball lightning once. It was the most magical natural thing I have ever seen.
Positive graviolies congregating in space ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
